cluster_relations.rel_desc: The essay will discuss the use of body language across various situations.
The essay will discuss how body language affects social interactions.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a document or discourse is about, discusses, or focuses on a given topic or subject.
args.justification: Both relations link the same subject entity (an essay on body language) to different topics it will discuss. The rel_hint_type is 'aboutness' and the rel_descs describe the content focus of the essay (various situations; social interactions). These are standard document-to-topic aboutness links and share identical predicate semantics, so they should use a unified canonical predicate 'is_about'.

Both relations connect a document-like entity (essay on body language) to conceptual topics it discusses (various situations; social interactions). This is a classic document-to-subject linkage, so grouping them under a relation class 'document_subject_relation' is appropriate.
The rel_hint_type is explicitly 'aboutness', and the semantics clearly express what the essay is about. This fits a broad ABOUTNESS dimension rather than composition, causality, or spatiality.
